### Solicitation Information

The Government of Canada invites contractors to submit a qualification proposal for the Rushbrook Harbour Mooring Pile Repair project. This is a two-phase procurement process, with Phase 1 evaluating the qualifications of all bidders and Phase 2 inviting qualified bidders to provide a financial proposal for the project.

#### Project Description

The project entails the replacement of mooring piles, pile blocking, and gangway at the Rushbrook Small Craft Harbour, Prince Rupert, British Columbia. The scope of work includes:

* Mobilization and demobilization to the harbour site
* Replacement of mooring piles, including supply and installation of new piles and associated hardware
* Replacement of pile blocking, including supply and installation of new blocking and associated hardware
* Replacement of gangway, including supply and installation of new gangway and associated hardware
* Site cleanup and disposal of waste materials
* Miscellaneous construction work as required

#### Tender Specifications

The tender package includes specifications and drawings for the project. Bidders are expected to visit the site and familiarize themselves with the work to be completed, including the means of access, soil conditions, and any accommodations required.

#### Timeline

The expected completion date for the project is February 17, 2023.

#### Contact Information

For further information, please contact Karine Plante, DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca.
